reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21686, 'name': 'Matt Young', 'email': 'halcyondude@gmail.com', 'username': 'myoung'}, {'_account_id': 24752, 'name': 'RedHat RDO Downstream CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins+downstream@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci-downstream', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 27, 'created': '2017-03-02 20:14:13.000000000', 'files': ['roles/build-images/README.md', 'roles/build-images/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/build-images/tasks/fetch-images.yml', 'roles/build-images/templates/overcloud-image-build.sh.j2', 'playbooks/build-images-v2.yml', 'roles/build-images/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/build-images/meta/main.yml', 'roles/build-images/tasks/modify-image.yml', 'roles/build-images/tasks/convert-image.yml'], 'message': 'Add build-images role

Add new role to build overcloud and undercloud images.

This role can either operate directly against a host (direct)
or setup a build environment inside of a libvirt guest using
libguestfs-tools (isolated).

It starts by creating the overcloud images from the provided
yaml files. It then uses the convert-image role from
tripleo-quickstart to turn the overcloud-full.qcow2 image into
an undercloud image. Finally, it injects the previously created
overcloud-full and ironic-python-agent images into this new
undercloud image.

It is important to note that this process changes the type of
undercloud image produced. With the previous method we produced
a whole disk image for the undercloud, however by converting an
overcloud image we get a partition image for the undercloud. This
is because the overcloud image itself is a partition image.
The libvirt role in tripleo-quickstart handles this transparently,
and RDO is already producing the master image this way. However,
if we switch older releases to this method, external consumers of
the undercloud image not using tripleo-quickstart for libvirt
provisioning will be broken.

Change-Id: I7df1083291aa36cfef4aaacf9e345300ab5f4ed3
'}]
commit_message:
Add build-images role

Add new role to build overcloud and undercloud images.

This role can either operate directly against a host (direct)
or setup a build environment inside of a libvirt guest using
libguestfs-tools (isolated).

It starts by creating the overcloud images from the provided
yaml files. It then uses the convert-image role from
tripleo-quickstart to turn the overcloud-full.qcow2 image into
an undercloud image. Finally, it injects the previously created
overcloud-full and ironic-python-agent images into this new
undercloud image.

It is important to note that this process changes the type of
undercloud image produced. With the previous method we produced
a whole disk image for the undercloud, however by converting an
overcloud image we get a partition image for the undercloud. This
is because the overcloud image itself is a partition image.
The libvirt role in tripleo-quickstart handles this transparently,
and RDO is already producing the master image this way. However,
if we switch older releases to this method, external consumers of
the undercloud image not using tripleo-quickstart for libvirt
provisioning will be broken.

Change-Id: I7df1083291aa36cfef4aaacf9e345300ab5f4ed3

subject: Fix mac address inconsistencies in neutron and docker
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 9820, 'name': 'Liping Mao', 'email': 'limao@cisco.com', 'username': 'LipingMao'}, {'_account_id': 12860, 'name': 'Dongcan Ye', 'email': 'yedongcan@yeah.net', 'username': 'yedongcan'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 14867, 'name': 'Jaivish Kothari(janonymous)', 'email': 'janonymous.codevulture@gmail.com', 'username': 'Janonymous'}, {'_account_id': 21249, 'name': 'Quan Tian', 'email': 'qtian@vmware.com', 'username': 'tianquan'}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-14 02:59:01.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/test_kuryr.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/port_driver/drivers/test_vlan.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/test_kuryr_endpoint.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/base.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/port_driver/drivers/test_veth.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/port_driver/drivers/vlan.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/test_kuryr_ipam.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/controllers.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/port_driver/driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix mac address inconsistencies in neutron and docker

To specify the mac address of network interface, --mac-address should be
explicitly specified when running "docker run". However, the mac_address
of the neutron port owned by container is not set when created in
IpamDriver.RequestAddress and updated in NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint.
This causes the mac addresses in neutron and the docker to be
inconsistent.

This patch updates the mac_address of port in
NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint if the param is specified. Besides, due to
mac_address of bound ports can not be changed, the set of
'binding:host_id' is moved from IpamDriver.RequestAddress to
NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint.

Change-Id: I43e891171a7bd7ef30ab02abea4cdca2e5a39105
Closes-Bug: #1664036
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mac address inconsistencies in neutron and docker

To specify the mac address of network interface, --mac-address should be
explicitly specified when running "docker run". However, the mac_address
of the neutron port owned by container is not set when created in
IpamDriver.RequestAddress and updated in NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint.
This causes the mac addresses in neutron and the docker to be
inconsistent.

This patch updates the mac_address of port in
NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint if the param is specified. Besides, due to
mac_address of bound ports can not be changed, the set of
'binding:host_id' is moved from IpamDriver.RequestAddress to
NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint.

Change-Id: I43e891171a7bd7ef30ab02abea4cdca2e5a39105
Closes-Bug: #1664036

External OpenStack action mapping file support

Release note and command line parameter added.
From now it is optional to list openstack modules in mapping file which
you would not include into supported action set.

subject: Create a new python entrypoint for testing drivers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13719, 'name': 'Naohiro Tamura', 'email': 'naohirot.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'nao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-02 09:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/common/driver_factory.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Create a new python entrypoint for testing drivers

** WIP ** DO NOT MERGE
** This will probably fail all our CI tests right now **

This patch creates a new entrypoint "ironic.testing_drivers"
and moves all the test-centric drivers to that namespace.

It also adds a new CONF option which toggles whether the conductor
loads production drivers or test drivers. This makes it more clear
to operators which drivers they should (and should not) enable in
a production environment.

DocImpact:
    With this patch, it is no longer possible to load drivers which
    are intended for test environments and those intended for production
    environments in the same conductor service. This does not preclude
    running them in the same cluster -- this is possible by running
    more than one conductor service.

Change-Id: I251f2e88f9581a8657d657b2c4efe758cde11e85
'}]
commit_message:
Create a new python entrypoint for testing drivers

** WIP ** DO NOT MERGE
** This will probably fail all our CI tests right now **

This patch creates a new entrypoint "ironic.testing_drivers"
and moves all the test-centric drivers to that namespace.

It also adds a new CONF option which toggles whether the conductor
loads production drivers or test drivers. This makes it more clear
to operators which drivers they should (and should not) enable in
a production environment.

DocImpact:
    With this patch, it is no longer possible to load drivers which
    are intended for test environments and those intended for production
    environments in the same conductor service. This does not preclude
    running them in the same cluster -- this is possible by running
    more than one conductor service.

Change-Id: I251f2e88f9581a8657d657b2c4efe758cde11e85

commit_message:
Add missing documentation for secretutils

The current doc page for secretutils is blank [1], most likely because
of the way constant_time_compare is in the exception block.

This patch manually tells sphinx to doc the constant_time_compare
function. Also adds the oslo.utils version when the module was added.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/secretutils.html

Change-Id: Ic1fb15176c93f126826f568149cabf4b8e5450d8

Fix missing spaces in strings

Where strings are continued across multiple lines, it's easy to miss a
space. This fixes several incorrect strings, cleans up some formatting
(don't line break inside a format specifier) and fixes typos.

Change-Id: Id781b16cad03c32973a67c02ad22ce4459c6d126

commit_message:
Handle zero values when merging environments

When merging multiple envs, 0 values where ignored in later envs, not
taking precedence. This fixes it by checking for None instead.

Change-Id: Ia0da6988f92825bcc9a19dd3dcce771baa978a59
Closes-Bug: #1669442

commit_message:
Adjust scope of neutron agent notify

Shift notify under if condition to meet service resource relationship.
Also function has been modified to exclude creation
files with :: symbols.

Change-Id: I2cbf9c4b2c7a9796b7b7ab53733cc489b03e533b
Related-Bug: #1613724
Closes-bug: #1658952

subject: fix workflow exception on host aggregate create form
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 03:40:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/aggregates/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/aggregates/workflows.py'], 'message': 'fix workflow exception on host aggregate create form

Under the circumstance that there are existing aggregates, this bug
happens when create button is clicked without the required "name" field
filled. Error toast shows instead of the expected error message on the
create form.
When the form posts without name filed filled, the name attribute in the
clean data is None instead of an empty string, which causes
AttributeError on the following string operation.

1. patch an empty string as the fallback value for the 'name' variable
2. corresponding unit test is attached

Change-Id: I0bdf469d87aa06ab58b73e6ce41bdf63bb36a538
Closes-Bug: #1617140
'}]
commit_message:
fix workflow exception on host aggregate create form

Under the circumstance that there are existing aggregates, this bug
happens when create button is clicked without the required "name" field
filled. Error toast shows instead of the expected error message on the
create form.
When the form posts without name filed filled, the name attribute in the
clean data is None instead of an empty string, which causes
AttributeError on the following string operation.

1. patch an empty string as the fallback value for the 'name' variable
2. corresponding unit test is attached

Change-Id: I0bdf469d87aa06ab58b73e6ce41bdf63bb36a538
Closes-Bug: #1617140

subject: Fix Swift ring deployment and Newton to Ocata upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 18:09:31.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/deployment.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix Swift ring deployment and Newton to Ocata upgrades

If an upgrade started without the latest newton/stable version of
tripleo-common, this currently will fail because the temporary URLs are
not created.

While debugging this I noticed that the workflow is not correct;
actually the Swift ring temporary URLs need to be created always before
starting the deployment. Without this patch, temporary URLs were not
created if validations are not run - which was the case when upgrading
the overcloud.

This needs to be fixed for Ocata even if the latest stable/newton
release has been deployed before the upgrade started, otherwise it might
just fail later on (if there are any deployments without doing the
validations).

Closes-Bug: 1669068
Change-Id: I765498c668932e3c95caeb53e4b73d00990898f4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift ring deployment and Newton to Ocata upgrades

If an upgrade started without the latest newton/stable version of
tripleo-common, this currently will fail because the temporary URLs are
not created.

While debugging this I noticed that the workflow is not correct;
actually the Swift ring temporary URLs need to be created always before
starting the deployment. Without this patch, temporary URLs were not
created if validations are not run - which was the case when upgrading
the overcloud.

This needs to be fixed for Ocata even if the latest stable/newton
release has been deployed before the upgrade started, otherwise it might
just fail later on (if there are any deployments without doing the
validations).

Closes-Bug: 1669068
Change-Id: I765498c668932e3c95caeb53e4b73d00990898f4

commit_message:
Update test requirement

Since pbr already landed and the old version of hacking seems not
work very well with pbr>=2, we should update it to match global
requirement.

In addition, this patch disable multiattach in fullstack tests
since this option was disabled in Cinder [1]

NOTE: This commit actually contains two fixes: one is for fixing
the test requirement and the other is for fixing the fullstack
tests. Ideally, we should split it into two commits but we are not
able to do it because we need both fixes in one patch to unblock
the gate.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/428365/

Closes-Bug: #1669494
Partial-Bug: #1668848
Change-Id: I6770eda1cf232aa8528190c82f1868a82372b159

subject: Fix binary ironic-inspector rootwrap configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 16:33:33.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ironic/ironic-inspector/ironic_sudoers_source', 'docker/ironic/ironic-inspector/ironic_sudoers_binary', 'docker/ironic/ironic-inspector/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Fix binary ironic-inspector rootwrap configuration

When built with the binary install type (at least on CentOS), Ironic
inspector fails to start and the container remains in a restarting
state. The log file shows that it is failing to execute iptables, and
analysis found that this was due to an incorrect rootwrap
configuration. The RDO ironic inspector RPM expects Ironic inspector
to be run as the ironic-inspector user, however Kolla uses the ironic
user. This means that neither of the packaged ironic nor
ironic-inspector sudoers configuration files works for us.

Kolla currently installs a sudoers file pointing to the rootwrap
script in the virtualenv of the source install, but of course this
only makes sense for source installs, and should not be installed for
binary installs.

This change adds a second sudoers file that will work for the binary
install type, and installs the correct sudoers file for the install
type.

Change-Id: I8ecd0b658b8df8f38ddf717fa9443d4dc2896984
Closes-Bug: #1624457
(cherry picked from commit 5752c7eb0b1f9c5978dd4e9271ded346cea231e0)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix binary ironic-inspector rootwrap configuration

When built with the binary install type (at least on CentOS), Ironic
inspector fails to start and the container remains in a restarting
state. The log file shows that it is failing to execute iptables, and
analysis found that this was due to an incorrect rootwrap
configuration. The RDO ironic inspector RPM expects Ironic inspector
to be run as the ironic-inspector user, however Kolla uses the ironic
user. This means that neither of the packaged ironic nor
ironic-inspector sudoers configuration files works for us.

Kolla currently installs a sudoers file pointing to the rootwrap
script in the virtualenv of the source install, but of course this
only makes sense for source installs, and should not be installed for
binary installs.

This change adds a second sudoers file that will work for the binary
install type, and installs the correct sudoers file for the install
type.

Change-Id: I8ecd0b658b8df8f38ddf717fa9443d4dc2896984
Closes-Bug: #1624457
(cherry picked from commit 5752c7eb0b1f9c5978dd4e9271ded346cea231e0)

commit_message:
Add work-dir command-line option

The working directory was previously generated as a temporary one,
but there may be cases when we want to specify a directory, for
example if we want to generate the Dockerfiles and then do some
parsing on them.

commit_message:
Packages for distributed serialization added to bootstrap

We are going to use bootstrap nodes as workers for distributed
task serialization. Package python-dispy is used as
remote worker implementation. Package python-dispy requires
python-asyncoro. Also we need to have fuel-nailgun installed on
the node as library (without running services). Serialization
implementation from fuel-nailgun is used by job for python-dispy
worker.

Change-Id: Ib0fcabd7d210ce43503b4fc7d98cc3a7e1b0bbc9
Implements: blueprint distributed-serialization

subject: Reslient bootstrapping for MariaDB
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-18 10:57:51.000000000', 'files': ['docker/mariadb/extend_start.sh'], 'message': "Reslient bootstrapping for MariaDB

This improves resiliency of the bootstrapping process for MariaDB,
making the MariaDB deployment safer and easier as well.

The changes are particularly useful for environments where there's
expectation of creating resources without additional
orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes), but they shouldn't negatively affect
traditional appraoches to deploying the MariaDB Kolla container.

The effects are:

* It doesn't matter in which order the MariaDB worker vs. MariaDB
  bootstrap containers are started. As long as they have a policy to
  restart, they'll converge to the correct results.

* The MariaDB worker container won't attempt to start the database if
  the bootstrap hasn't been performed yet (data directory missing, would
  fail anyway) or in progress (bootstrap lock present), which could lead
  to errors.

* Neither the worker nor the bootstrap container will attempt to do
  operations if there's already a pid file present, indicating that
  another DB process is already working with the data
  directory. Attempting to run would result in a failure/deadlock
  anyway, but at least we get a clear message.

Change-Id: Iddeb1c8f5e64420ed5d07a34804c3f12b4a89073
"}]
commit_message:
Reslient bootstrapping for MariaDB

This improves resiliency of the bootstrapping process for MariaDB,
making the MariaDB deployment safer and easier as well.

The changes are particularly useful for environments where there's
expectation of creating resources without additional
orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes), but they shouldn't negatively affect
traditional appraoches to deploying the MariaDB Kolla container.

The effects are:

* It doesn't matter in which order the MariaDB worker vs. MariaDB
  bootstrap containers are started. As long as they have a policy to
  restart, they'll converge to the correct results.

* The MariaDB worker container won't attempt to start the database if
  the bootstrap hasn't been performed yet (data directory missing, would
  fail anyway) or in progress (bootstrap lock present), which could lead
  to errors.

* Neither the worker nor the bootstrap container will attempt to do
  operations if there's already a pid file present, indicating that
  another DB process is already working with the data
  directory. Attempting to run would result in a failure/deadlock
  anyway, but at least we get a clear message.

Change-Id: Iddeb1c8f5e64420ed5d07a34804c3f12b4a89073

commit_message:
Ensure that instance directory is removed after success migration/resize

Nova recreates instance directory on source host after successful migration/resize.
This patch removes directory of migrated instance from source host.

Change-Id: Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4
Closes-Bug: #1666831

commit_message:
Pass located tests directory in oslo debug

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: Id57f5c09e12410accd72d05250faeb8dd5da7117
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker processes

Users can configure the number of worker processes. However when
it's not specified the calculated number of workers can get too
large on hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Iaa0cd5eba460d50cae18ba25f88a2d2c57a5cc85

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker processes

Users can configure the number of worker processes. However when
it's not specified the calculated number of workers can get too
large on hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Ieb1afbd5c872cc4a991b51287b57404b8932fafa

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-02 13:14:41.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/capping_aodh_wsgi_processes-6db6da9ba36c8851.yaml'], 'message': "Cap the number of worker processes

Users can configure the number of worker processes. However when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Ieb6202e92ce1dcb6f94affd550bd6ce2065ef4bc
"}]
commit_message:
Cap the number of worker processes

Users can configure the number of worker processes. However when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Ieb6202e92ce1dcb6f94affd550bd6ce2065ef4bc

subject: Fix hardcoded reset system path
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-02 23:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['sushy/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'sushy/resources/system/system.py', 'sushy/utils.py', 'sushy/tests/unit/resources/system/test_system.py'], 'message': "Fix hardcoded reset system path

Closes-Bug: #1668434
"}]
commit_message:
Fix hardcoded reset system path

Previously, the path of resetting system is hardcoded to
'/Actions/ComputerSystem.Reset'. Actually redfish provide 'target'
attribution for each action. So use it instead of hardcode.

Change-Id: Id5aaa418ff5ffc693afc593db5c4dc852b5b6c33
Closes-Bug: #1668434

subject: add missing instance meta
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 20:03:03.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/meter/data/meters.yaml', 'ceilometer/dispatcher/gnocchi.py'], 'message': "add missing instance meta

flavor_id, flavor_name, display_name and host are required... we need to
include them when we build sample from notification.

host does not exist in compute.instance.create.start messages because
(i assume) nova doesn't know which host to create on yet.

also, when multiple metrics missing same resource, only attempt to
create once.

Change-Id: Ia680ad23608f6712ebce619797e2968f8acc6310
(cherry picked from commit 48d9cb77937de43da1b9056f2eb203835a3625c3)
"}]
commit_message:
add missing instance meta

flavor_id, flavor_name, display_name and host are required... we need to
include them when we build sample from notification.

host does not exist in compute.instance.create.start messages because
(i assume) nova doesn't know which host to create on yet.

also, when multiple metrics missing same resource, only attempt to
create once.

Change-Id: Ia680ad23608f6712ebce619797e2968f8acc6310
(cherry picked from commit 48d9cb77937de43da1b9056f2eb203835a3625c3)

commit_message:
Remove skip test from murano engine package loader unit test.

Removes the @testtools.skipIf decorator from
test_load_package_except_lookup_error in
murano.unit.tests.engine.test_package_loader, because related bug was
removed [1].

This patch makes a trivial change by removing the skip.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384713/

Change-Id: I86cfe4cedd63b0224fcc0186cdba671bb91004e9
Related-Bug: #1632107

commit_message:
doc: kuryr-k8s components missed Watch consumer

In the previous version of the diagram, it appeared as if the controller
only Patched Kubernetes API resources, when it's main driving force is
the Watching of resources. This patch puts a new svg and png that
represent the interaction properly.

Change-Id: Iaa1d7aadd80b1403d8f29112050afd70a08f9bac
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

subject: Use lazy formatting when logging
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 13702, 'name': 'yushiro', 'username': 'yushiro', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-02 23:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/firewall_l3_agent.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_fwaas_v2.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/firewall_l3_agent_v2.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Use lazy formatting when logging

We should replace the patterns:

 LOG.$level(msg % (arg0, arg1))
 LOG.$level(msg % dictionary)

by:

 LOG.$level(msg, arg0, arg1)
 LOG.$level(msg, dictionary)

in order to format logging message when the level is enabled.

Change-Id: I1615d49693051a1cd9476fe54a74aeb2d58e04a7
'}]
commit_message:
Use lazy formatting when logging

We should replace the patterns:

 LOG.$level(msg % (arg0, arg1))
 LOG.$level(msg % dictionary)

by:

 LOG.$level(msg, arg0, arg1)
 LOG.$level(msg, dictionary)

in order to format logging message when the level is enabled.

Change-Id: I1615d49693051a1cd9476fe54a74aeb2d58e04a7

subject: scripts: test-bifrost.sh: Initialize the ZUUL_BRANCH variable
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 00:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/test-bifrost.sh'], 'message': 'scripts: test-bifrost.sh: Initialize the ZUUL_BRANCH variable

Commit afa9951dd92e2 ("Move database setup to bifrost") moved the
openstack_citest database setup from project-config to bifrost.
However, we need to provide a default (even if it's an empty one)
value for ZUUL_BRANCH (eg when running outside of zuul) in order
to not fail due to using 'set -u'. Fixes the following error:

./scripts/test-bifrost.sh: line 76: ZUUL_BRANCH: unbound variable

Change-Id: Iea1193ce0ac83013f4e41398b4e7ad9527d427ac
Fixes: afa9951dd92e2 ("Move database setup to bifrost")
'}]
commit_message:
scripts: test-bifrost.sh: Initialize the ZUUL_BRANCH variable

Commit afa9951dd92e2 ("Move database setup to bifrost") moved the
openstack_citest database setup from project-config to bifrost.
However, we need to provide a default (even if it's an empty one)
value for ZUUL_BRANCH (eg when running outside of zuul) in order
to not fail due to using 'set -u'. Fixes the following error:

./scripts/test-bifrost.sh: line 76: ZUUL_BRANCH: unbound variable

Change-Id: Iea1193ce0ac83013f4e41398b4e7ad9527d427ac
Fixes: afa9951dd92e2 ("Move database setup to bifrost")

subject: Re-implement openstack-ansible-tests func job to test ARA
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-20 21:36:40.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ara.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Re-implement openstack-ansible-tests func job to test ARA

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435570/ we added an OSA
job to ARA and later had to revert it because the way the jobs are
designed to work do not fit with ARA.
The current job layout for OSA expects the project being tested
to have a tox env 'functional' which then proceeds to retrieve
openstack-ansible-tests and then fire tests from there.

ARA doesn't have 'functional' tox env but beyond that, we're
interested in testing that openstack-ansible-tests is able to
install and use ARA properly. Running tox from ARA's repository
installs ARA so it's a bit backwards.

Rather than change OSA's current testing methods, we'd much rather
re-implement a slightly changed job that always clone
openstack-ansible-tests and runs the functional tox env from there.
openstack-ansible-tests has the necessary code to zuul-clone ARA if
we're running in the ARA gate.

Change-Id: I883806aab498b7bbd686e5139edec9598f83952f
"}]
commit_message:
Re-implement openstack-ansible-tests func job to test ARA

In https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435570/ we added an OSA
job to ARA and later had to revert it because the way the jobs are
designed to work do not fit with ARA.
The current job layout for OSA expects the project being tested
to have a tox env 'functional' which then proceeds to retrieve
openstack-ansible-tests and then fire tests from there.

ARA doesn't have 'functional' tox env but beyond that, we're
interested in testing that openstack-ansible-tests is able to
install and use ARA properly. Running tox from ARA's repository
installs ARA so it's a bit backwards.

Rather than change OSA's current testing methods, we'd much rather
re-implement a slightly changed job that always clone
openstack-ansible-tests and runs the functional tox env from there.
openstack-ansible-tests has the necessary code to zuul-clone ARA if
we're running in the ARA gate.

Change-Id: I883806aab498b7bbd686e5139edec9598f83952f

subject: openstack-repos: fail on missing project list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 06:18:44.000000000', 'files': ['tools/build-image.sh', 'nodepool/elements/openstack-repos/extra-data.d/50-create-repo-list'], 'message': "openstack-repos: fail on missing project list

If you specify a CUSTOM_PROJECTS_LIST_URL that doesn't exist you get a
message but the script continues.  Since you clearly meant to specify
something we should bail so the user can correct the problem.

Additionally, add some documentation to the build-image.sh script to
describe how to use this to cut down build times considerably for
initial testing purposes.

Change-Id: I02d1cd341f793471b1ad4374e98031ea53db7f49
"}]
commit_message:
openstack-repos: fail on missing project list

If you specify a CUSTOM_PROJECTS_LIST_URL that doesn't exist you get a
message but the script continues.  Since you clearly meant to specify
something we should bail so the user can correct the problem.

Additionally, add some documentation to the build-image.sh script to
describe how to use this to cut down build times considerably for
initial testing purposes.

Change-Id: I02d1cd341f793471b1ad4374e98031ea53db7f49

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 09:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py'], 'message': 'Do not call image.stat() when we only need the size

The image.stat() call seems to be broken in ceph-10.2.2, see [1]. Since
we only need the size of the image, call image.size() instead [2].

[1] http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/17310
[2] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rbd/librbdpy/#rbd.Image.size

(cherry picked from commit 69b2b8cd008dbc2e999d33cf941f7b5531166145)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not call image.stat() when we only need the size

The image.stat() call seems to be broken in ceph-10.2.2, see [1]. Since
we only need the size of the image, call image.size() instead [2].

[1] http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/17310
[2] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rbd/librbdpy/#rbd.Image.size

Change-Id: I82d411f886d8895e8a2e6cbb0907576c22f5f346
(cherry picked from commit 69b2b8cd008dbc2e999d33cf941f7b5531166145)

commit_message:
Replace image.stat() with image.size() call

The fix in [1] was incomplete, there is a second call to image.stat() in
the code, which can trigger the same bug [2].

[1] I82d411f886d8895e8a2e6cbb0907576c22f5f346
[2] http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/17310

Co-Authored-By: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Change-Id: Iabdb8973a0a9f606b9656ea2dd244d6312c8fe37

subject: main script: add zuul-clone default path for upstream ci
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-16 13:16:06.000000000', 'files': ['quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'main script: add zuul-clone default path for upstream ci

the esisting block in charge of cloning the correct commit of extras in
case of upstreeam depends-On relies on a environment variable that was
missing.
Adding ZUUL_CLONER variable at the start of the script with the default
devstack-gate location, allows quickstart to clone the correct
dependent commit in upstream.

Change-Id: Idefcd501e22f961dbd07c826e37816861888abe2
'}]
commit_message:
main script: add zuul-clone default path for upstream ci

the esisting block in charge of cloning the correct commit of extras in
case of upstreeam depends-On relies on a environment variable that was
missing.
Adding ZUUL_CLONER variable at the start of the script with the default
devstack-gate location, allows quickstart to clone the correct
dependent commit in upstream.

Change-Id: Idefcd501e22f961dbd07c826e37816861888abe2

commit_message:
Disallow assgined floating IP that already assigned to other ports.

While associate floating IP to port, we did not check the
floating IP is already assigned to another port or not.

Closes-Bug:#1659215

Change-Id: I35f12c2005f8b96bef9ceb5fc2c87c63a212eb5c
Co-Authored-By: ZhaoBo<zhaobo6@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Enable sphinx warnings

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, we need to use warning-is-error for sphinx
warnings.

Disable the non-local-uri warning, it's raised by our badge in
README.rst.

Change-Id: I77ff11a3cd0742bc4c1a6e7037644801877f6661

commit_message:
Add some unit test cases for l3 proactive app

l3 proactive app lack of unit test cases about add and remove ports.
This patch will add a unit test case about it.
The cases about the process of routes when a port was added or
removed will be added in another patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426601/

Change-Id: I7028e12ede3d83e046b284c601202594d111152c

subject: [Fix gate]Update to a newer hacking library
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-03 03:51:37.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': "[Fix gate]Update to a newer hacking library

1. What is the problem?
The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, which is causing
issues with the recent 2.0.0 release of pbr

2. What is the solution for the problem?
Hacking isn't kept in sync via the usual proposal bot updates so
update it manually to fix the pep8 gate.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
   realize the solution?
None

Partial-Bug: #1668848

Change-Id: I805565843c9228b729e242c3f2fddf14b6a3130e
"}]
commit_message:
[Fix gate]Update to a newer hacking library

1. What is the problem?
The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, which is causing
issues with the recent 2.0.0 release of pbr

2. What is the solution for the problem?
Hacking isn't kept in sync via the usual proposal bot updates so
update it manually to fix the pep8 gate.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
   realize the solution?
None

Partial-Bug: #1668848

Change-Id: I805565843c9228b729e242c3f2fddf14b6a3130e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 08:02:45.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I66b76645b7799c6550583c675bc968310d5e0d1c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I66b76645b7799c6550583c675bc968310d5e0d1c

subject: Fixes test_toggle_public_package ui tests failing in tearDown.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-03 03:23:41.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "Fixes test_toggle_public_package ui tests failing in tearDown.

Currently, 2 tests:
  - test_toggle_public_package
  - test_toggle_public_multiple_packages
both throw keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure
errors during tearDown [0] (this one example resulted in the
same failure 3 times in a row).

Since these are the only two tests that dynamically create
a project using keystoneclient and delete the projects
in tearDown, this patch provides a workaround by removing
the create_project function and removing the need to then
clean up the project in tearDown.

This is done by relying on the alternate project 'service'
(already used in test_sharing_app_without_permission),
instead of having to create a new project then deleting it.

Also combines https://review.openstack.org/#/c/440219/
to fix flake8 error.

[0] https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/40/436240/1/check/gate-murano-dashboard-ubuntu/14801da/

Related-Bug: #1668848
Co-Authored-By: ricolin <rico.lin@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Id77e0cc59f33fdf394e2dc25a9fda0fd13c5b4fa
Backport: stable/ocata
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes test_toggle_public_package ui tests failing in tearDown.

Currently, 2 tests:
  - test_toggle_public_package
  - test_toggle_public_multiple_packages
both throw keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.ConnectFailure
errors during tearDown [0] (this one example resulted in the
same failure 3 times in a row).

Since these are the only two tests that dynamically create
a project using keystoneclient and delete the projects
in tearDown, this patch provides a workaround by removing
the create_project function and removing the need to then
clean up the project in tearDown.

This is done by relying on the alternate project 'service'
(already used in test_sharing_app_without_permission),
instead of having to create a new project then deleting it.

Also combines https://review.openstack.org/#/c/440219/
to fix flake8 error.

[0] https://murano-ci.mirantis.com/logs/40/436240/1/check/gate-murano-dashboard-ubuntu/14801da/

Related-Bug: #1668848
Co-Authored-By: ricolin <rico.lin@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Id77e0cc59f33fdf394e2dc25a9fda0fd13c5b4fa
Backport: stable/ocata

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-22 19:31:01.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Handle getattrs to ConfigOpts for deprecated opts

There are libraries and tools which offer their config interface as
a stable backwards compatible interface both in code and as user
facing interface. A vital part of being able to make changes to this
is to handle deprecation and moving options. While oslo.config offers
a fairly rich deprecation mechanism it only exposes itself on the
user facing side. If a project wishes to deprecate an option for
code consumers who wish to use the config definitions externally they
will break by any change that deprecates an option. This commit fixes
this issue by doing a lookup on the deprecated options as a fallback
on a getattr. This way if an option is not found all the deprecated
options are checked, if a matching deprecated opt is found a warning
is logged and it's value is used.

Change-Id: I6e28c25f04273f7def486fadd541babc8cf423cb
"}]
commit_message:
Handle getattrs to ConfigOpts for deprecated opts

There are libraries and tools which offer their config interface as
a stable backwards compatible interface both in code and as user
facing interface. A vital part of being able to make changes to this
is to handle deprecation and moving options. While oslo.config offers
a fairly rich deprecation mechanism it only exposes itself on the
user facing side. If a project wishes to deprecate an option for
code consumers who wish to use the config definitions externally they
will break by any change that deprecates an option. This commit fixes
this issue by doing a lookup on the deprecated options as a fallback
on a getattr. This way if an option is not found all the deprecated
options are checked, if a matching deprecated opt is found a warning
is logged and it's value is used.

Change-Id: I6e28c25f04273f7def486fadd541babc8cf423cb

subject: Fix db_version checking for sqlalchemy-migrate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 01:29:52.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_migration_common.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/migration.py'], 'message': "Fix db_version checking for sqlalchemy-migrate

When a project has multiple migration repos and
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.migration.db_version() is called using the one
repo as the abs_path, it will attempt to put the repo under version
control. The next time it's called with the other abs_path, it would
fail rather than attempting to put the repo under version control
when using sqlalchemy-migrate. When using alembic, db_version would
attempt to put the new abs_path under version control.

This change makes it so that when sqlalchemy-migrate is used
db_version() will attempt to version control the new abs_path just
like when alembic is used.

Change-Id: If5e2ae1a72f9118c7aca34e925fdc5e3e8480275
"}]
commit_message:
Fix db_version checking for sqlalchemy-migrate

When a project has multiple migration repos and
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.migration.db_version() is called using the one
repo as the abs_path, it will attempt to put the repo under version
control. The next time it's called with the other abs_path, it would
fail rather than attempting to put the repo under version control
when using sqlalchemy-migrate. When using alembic, db_version would
attempt to put the new abs_path under version control.

This change makes it so that when sqlalchemy-migrate is used
db_version() will attempt to version control the new abs_path just
like when alembic is used.

Change-Id: If5e2ae1a72f9118c7aca34e925fdc5e3e8480275

commit_message:
Container logs is not good user experience

Zun only supports stdout and stderr arguments,
users need more options like tail, since, time period etc.

Change-Id: I150e9c1bd8e4099d575624b1e0cbed7b00f63c35
Closes-Bug: #1667182

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 10:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/compute/test_nova.py', 'masakari/conf/nova.py'], 'message': 'Change nova_catalog_admin_info to default to publicURL

"EndpointNotFound: adminURL endpoint for compute service not found"

This patch changes the default for the nova_catalog_admin_info to be

call nova's admin restricted apis.

[1] Ided7a65c81b3a0b56f0184847fc82e17c29a771e
Closes-Bug: #1669280
Change-Id: I90bc214249f8a542f2d40fca544af204e0665821

commit_message:
Change nova_catalog_admin_info to default to publicURL

A recent change in devstack [1] reduced the number of endpoints
configured by default. This breaks masakari resulting into:
"EndpointNotFound: adminURL endpoint for compute service not found"

This patch changes the default for the nova_catalog_admin_info to be
the normal 'publicURL'. With 'publicURL' masakari-engine is able to
call nova's admin restricted apis.

[1] Ided7a65c81b3a0b56f0184847fc82e17c29a771e
Closes-Bug: #1669280
Change-Id: I90bc214249f8a542f2d40fca544af204e0665821

commit_message:
Update to a newer hacking library

The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, with the recent 2.0.0
release of PBR it's causing failures in the pep8 job. hacking isn't
kept in sync via the typical proposal-bot updates. Do it manually to
clear the gate issue.

Please see gate logs for reference:
http://logs.openstack.org/31/406931/1/check/gate-masakari-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/1e8b199/console.html

Related-Bug: #1668848
Change-Id: I5fd77ca87266034c42dae59fd28ede7f6b9dd382
